org.deuce.transaction.tl2cm
Class Context

java.lang.Object
  org.deuce.transaction.tl2cm.Context
All Implemented Interfaces:
Context
public final class Context
extends java.lang.Object
implements Context

Context class for TL2 STM with Contention Management support. This class queries its Contention Manager regarding the need for bookkeeping of shared information, like priorities, currently running transaction, etc. Based on Guy Korland's and Pascal Felber's work on org.deuce.transaction.tl2.* and org.deuce.transaction.lsa*

Author:
Yoav Cohen, yoav.cohen@cs.tau.ac.il

rollback

public void rollback()
Description copied from interface: Context
Called on rollback, rollback might be called more than once in a row. But, can't be called after Context.commit() without an #init(int, String)) call in between.

Specified by:
rollback in interface Context

kill

public boolean kill()
Kills this transaction if it is still running

Returns:
true if the kill operation succeeded, false otherwise

public int getLocalClock()
Gets the clock value of the current transaction

Returns:
clock value of the current transaction

getTimestamp

public int getTimestamp()
Gets the timestamp of the current transaction. The timestamp of the current transaction is the local clock value of the first attempt made by this thread to execute the current transaction.

Returns:
timestamp of the current transaction

getPriority

public int getPriority()
Gets the priority of this thread. The priority is calculated based on the number of locks this thread has opened and not committed on.

Returns:
thread's priority

getStatistics

public Statistics getStatistics()
